titlestmt.titleproper: A Guide to the Max Oser films FA266
titlestmt.author: Eva Grizzard

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2016-11-01 17:12:39 -0400.

physdesc.extent: 45 individual films, in 400 ft canisters. 45 access copy DVDs.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processed by Eva Grizzard, 2011 and Laura Montgomery, 2015.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. All inquiries to view films require advanced notice of at least 48 business hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those that are not available in modern formats, may require creation of an access surrogate. Applicable charges will apply.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Information regarding the Rockefeller Archive Center's preferred elements and forms of citation can be found at http://www.rockarch.org/research/citations.php

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 45 black-and-white films shot by the Oser Family in the 1920s-1940s. The films are silent, unedited travelogues with footage from around the world. Several members of the Rockefeller Family make appearences in various films, as well as footage at different Rockefeller homes.

did.physdesc: Silent, Black and White, 10 minutes. Condition is okay. Film is warped by still playable; strong vinegar syndrome.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Inter-tribal Indian ceremonial gathering in Gallup, New Mexico.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: All inquires to view films require advanced notice of at least 24 hours, and may necessitate notice of up to one week. Individual items, including those not available in modern formats, may be restricted from scholarly access at the discretion of RAC.
